intro: Pycreus monti, commonly known as the mountain pycreus, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine regions. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
